festival.introText:
The 21st, 22nd and 23rd of July 2023 brings the third instalment of 'Craic by the Creek', a fresh and unique festival celebration of Irish Music nestled in the rolling green hills of Cheshire.

Think huge, weekend-long St Patrick’s Day celebrations with the added hot summer weather it deserves. The inaugural sell-out festival, in 2021, was a big party with an incredible atmosphere, incredible food and incredible music. The sell out second year was even better!

'Craic by the Creek' brings some of the biggest names in traditional and contemporary Irish music to the Greater Manchester countryside.

With a wonderful variety of food, drink and camping facilities on site, you’ll have everything at hand to experience a great festival of Irish and Country music.

Make a weekend of it! Onsite camping and glamping is available for festival-goers - tickets must be purchased alongside a standard entry ticket.

If you are bringing a motorhome, camper or caravan, you must purchase a ticket to bring your vehicle. You must also buy camping tickets for each person who will be staying in your motorhome, camper or caravan.

Disabled Access Information please contact the festival office directly - info@craicbythecreek.co.uk

Please note Craic by the Creek is a family friendly event but anyone under the age of 12 years MUST be accompanied by an Adult and must have their own ticket.
festival.descriptionText: Skiddle is an official ticket outlet of Craic by the Creek 2023. Get Craic by the Creek Festival tickets, news and information with Skiddle.com

faqs.question: When is Craic by the Creek 2023?
faqs.answer: Craic by the Creek takes place over three days from Friday the 21st of July to Sunday the 23rd of July 2023.

faqs.question: What happens if I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent. Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Can I park at Craic by the Creek?
faqs.answer:
Yes, the post code for the car park is SK6 5HH and will code £20 per car for the whole weekend. Please note this is a cash only car park.

 

The car park is a 15 minute walk through Etherow Country Park to the festival site, which is the quickest route. There is also a shuttle bus in operation throughout the weekend although the drive can get congested so you may need to wait.

faqs.question: What is 'Pitch Up Thursday'?
faqs.answer:
Cars are not allowed on the lane up to the festival site or on Whitebottom Farm itself on the festival weekend. Unfortunately, this is a security issue. However, campers and Motorhome festival goers have the option of driving onto the festival site on the Thursday to pitch up their tent with all of their camping gear.

 

'Pitch Up Thursday' will take place between the hours of 5pm and 8pm. Any belongings left on the festival site at this time are left at the risk of the owner. If you would like to put your name down for this service, please fill out the form at https://craicbythecreek.co.uk/pitch-up-thursday.

 

Please be aware, cars must NOT be left on site and must be removed by 8pm. If you are using a car to tow a caravan, you must remove your car as this cannot be left next to your caravan over the festival weekend as per the site rules.

 

There won't be any entertainment on Thursday and no food vendors, but the bar will be open and you can bring your own food. The shower and toilet facilities will of course be open too.

faqs.question: Disabled access information
faqs.answer: A limited number of disabled parking spots are available to those who hold a valid blue badge and valid weekend tickets. Spaces are limited and must be booked in advance at https://craicbythecreek.co.uk/disabled-access.

faqs.question: Where is Craic by the Creek?
faqs.answer: Craic by the Creek is located at Whitebottom farm in Etherow Country Park, Compstall, Stockport SK6 5JQ. Use postcode SK6 5HZ and then follow festival signs to the Festival Car Park on Compstall Road, SK6 5HH/

faqs.question: How do I get to Craic by the Creek using public transport?
faqs.answer: The nearest railway stations are Marple and Romiley. Stockport station is also nearby with buses every 15 minutes.

faqs.question: Can I park my Motorhome / Caravan near friends?
faqs.answer: If you want to park next to your friends at the festival, you will need to turn up at the same time. You will not be able to reserve areas as space is restricted.

faqs.question: Do I need cash or tokens for the food vendors at Craic by the Creek?
faqs.answer: All food vendors and festival market stalls will be cash / card only. They do not use the token system - this is exclusive to the bar.

faqs.question: Is there an electric hook up?
faqs.answer: No, however you can access charger points for phones and the shower facilities include sockets for hairdryers and straighteners.

faqs.question: What time can I access the festival site at Craic by the Creek?
faqs.answer:
The Craic by the Creek site will be accessible from midday on the Friday morning. The entertainment won't begin until the evening but campers,  glampers, Motorhomes / Campervans and Caravan ticket holders can arrive and pitch their tents / get settled from 12pm. The festival bar will be open from midday and food vendors will be on site.

 

If you are a general admission ticket holder (and are not camping / glamping etc.) you can still turn up from midday if you wish. The bar will be open for you to get a head start on the masses/

faqs.question: Can I access drinking water?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can access free drinking water, situated in the shower area.

faqs.question: What time does the entertainment start and end at Craic by the Creek?
faqs.answer: Entertainment at Craic by the Creek will begin from 6pm on Friday evening and will end on Sunday at 9pm. The full music schedule by day will be released closer to the festival weekend.

faqs.question: Are glamping options available at Craic by the Creek?
What time do I have to leave Craic by the Creek?
faqs.answer: We kindly ask that all festival goers leave the festival site on Monday. If you're a camper, glamper, or bringing your motorhome, you are welcome to stay on the Sunday night and keep the party going until the early hours. There will be plenty of food and drink to keep you going!

faqs.question: I am staying over at Craic by the Creek, what is allowed and what is not allowed?
faqs.answer:
Allowed:

  • Small camping stove
  • Tent
  • Sleeping bag and extra blankets
  • It gets chilly at night
  • Wellies
  • Torch
  • Water proofs – Fingers crossed they won’t be needed
  • Sun cream
  • Medication – (prescription only)
  • Spare clothes
  • First aid kit
  • Money
  • Soft Drinks
  • Food or Snacks

Not Allowed:

  • No alcohol to be brought onsite – This is strictly in accordance with the rules of our alcohol license
  • No glass allowed
  • No illegal substances or legal highs
  • No fires or BBQs
  • No sound system
  • All children under 14 must be accompanied by an adult
  • Unruly behaviour is not accepted
  • No rucksacks in the barn / stage area - trip hazard
  • No public cars on site
